title.rendered: Latest hits for kids (Fortnite, Minecraft and more)

content.rendered:
Brawl Stars is a comic-style strategy and shooting game (“shooter”). You play “live” (i.e. in real time and online) against other players. At the beginning the player has only one character: Shelly. Like all other characters, this one is a so-called brawler. The “Jewel Hunt” is played first. Other game worlds or game modes are gradually being added, for example safe robbing or bounty hunting.

Alone or in a team, the brawlers then fight against others. There are rewards for eliminating an opponent and winning a game round: special attacks, additional game modes, coins, jewels, trophies – and you can move up to the higher league.

Stronger and more valuable brawlers are obtained through the brawl boxes. These are loot boxes (aka “loot boxes”) that you can buy with jewels. Gems are obtained as a reward in the game, but also in exchange for cash. However, the end of the game does not know which prizes are in the boxes. Rarer and more desirable brawlers are mostly found in the big, expensive boxes. (In some countries, for example in Belgium, the sale of such lucky boxes has been banned.) Parents should be careful here and accompany younger children in particular.

Strangers can also contact the child via the unmoderated chat. Therefore, a minimum age of 10 or 11 years is appropriate for this game (with close parental supervision). In its terms of use, the game manufacturer even mentions a minimum age of 14 for all of its game apps.
